channel.title: PS3 banned in Europe
channel.description:
LG succeeded in getting Europe to ban all import of new PS3 consoles based on a copyright infringement regarding blu-ray. This will be for a [i]minimum[/i] of 10 days, possibly longer.
Sony earlier tried to ban any new LG phone to be imported in the US, but lost that case. LG then successfully counterattacked and hit Sony harder than ever.
[url='https://www.ps3news.com/PlayStation-3/LG-Wins-Injunction-Against-Sony-PS3-European-Shipments-Seized/']Source[/url]

item.title: PS3 banned in Europe
item.dc:creator: jerry
item.description:
russilker:

Really, you can’t say they have no reason to sue him. Whether or not you agree with the way they run things, AFAIK what geohot does is illegal and Sony have every right to take him to court.

I would be much happier if they did things the way Microsoft is doing with Windows Phone 7, though.

except that what he did is pretty much the same as jailbreaking an iPhone, only the DMCA specifically makes jailbreaking/unlocking mobile devices legal. He only enabled homebrew apps, and the way piracy was previously done doesn’t work in his jailbreak. he has also never had any PSN account.

Read full topic

item.title: PS3 banned in Europe
item.dc:creator: SkyBlue
item.description:
It makes a nice change from companies just counter-suing each other and eventually settling by giving up the claims, like most tech involving similar products do (e.g. phones, microchips etc). Although 10 days isn’t much, I think it’s a nice gesture by the judge to show the big companies (who are so tough on piracy) that intellectual piracy of any sort is wrong, and that the courts can hit them where it hurts. If this goes on longer, I can see this really hurting Sony if there’s a rush to buy the remaining stock, which leaves very little on the shelves.

Read full topic
